books.title: The Virginian
books.author: Owen Wister
books.summary: A cowboy working on a Wyoming Territory cattle ranch in the 1880s embraces the spirit of the American West.

books.title: The Three Musketeers
books.author: Alexandre Dumas
books.summary: A young Gascon moves to Paris to join the King’s Musketeers where he starts to investigate the kidnapping of his landlord’s wife.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Stover at Yale
books.author: Owen Johnson
books.summary: A young prep school football star arrives at Yale, where he grows and develops on the football field and off.

books.title: Tartuffe
books.author: Molière
books.summary: A father announces his daughter will marry Tartuffe, a sanctimonious fraud and hypocrite.

books.title: The Taming of the Shrew
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: An unmarriageable shrew receives a marriage proposal.

books.title: The Gods of Pegāna
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: A mysterious god creates a cosmic pantheon to rule over its worlds and time.

books.title: Dodsworth
books.author: Sinclair Lewis
books.summary: A newly-retired businessman’s peaceful European trip falls apart as his wife chases high European society.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Frank Belknap Long
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Frank Belknap Long, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: The Mystery of Orcival
books.author: Émile Gaboriau
books.summary: A countess is murdered and suspects are quickly detained, but Lecoq is not satisfied and looks in a different direction to solve the case.

books.title: Essays
books.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
books.summary: A collection of Ralph Waldo Emerson’s essays.

books.title: The Wealth of Nations
books.author: Adam Smith
books.summary: Adam Smith lays the foundation of classical economics.

books.title: Songs of a Sourdough
books.author: Robert W. Service
books.summary: A collection of poems about the Klondike Gold Rush.

books.title: Democracy
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A wealthy New York widow moves to Washington, DC, hoping to get “to the heart of the great American mystery of democracy and government.”

books.title: The Inheritors
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: A young writer dabbling in journalism meets a strange, otherworldly woman with long-term political goals.

books.title: Allan Quatermain Stories
books.author: H. Rider Haggard
books.summary: A collection of short stories about a legendary hunter.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.
